editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: Fols. i-1 blank. Fols. 1v-3v contain the end of art. 5. On fol. 4rv, in a large anglicana hand, ‘Primus articulus in dominica passione est pauoris et tristicie assumpcio...65 est eiusdem corporis sepultura.’

msItem.title: Table of contents
msItem.note: In the hand of the main contents.

msItem.author: FRANCIS DE MEYRONNES OFM
msItem.title: Moralia
msItem.incipit: Auditu auris ...; Quia uero audicio diuina pertinet ad obedientie meritum
msItem.explicit: non crucifigere Dominum nostrum Iesum Christum cui ...
msItem.note: Unpr.; Roth, Franz von Mayronis, pp. 225–8; Bloomfield 0550.

msItem.author: FRANCIS DE MEYRONNES OFM
msItem.title: Quaestiones de Virtutibus Moralibus
msItem.incipit: Vtrum terreno principi sit necessaria pericia literarum. Quod non quia Saul electus fuit
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt octo morales questiones Francisci de Maronis
msItem.note: Unpr.; Roth, Franz von Mayronis, pp. 232–3; Bloomfield 6276, 6260.

msItem.author: FRANCIS DE MEYRONNES OFM
msItem.title: De Indulgentiis
msItem.incipit: Quodcumque ligaueris super terram ...; Duos fratres ultimos esse futuros in fine seculi describit beatus Augustinus
msItem.explicit: et pluit super iustos et iniustos cui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo doctoris Francisci de Maronis de indulgenciis in presentia domini pape et cardinalium.
msItem.note: Pr. Basel 1498; Roth, Franz von Mayronis, pp. 236–9; Bloomfield 4895; Schneyer, 131.

msItem.author: JORDAN OF QUEDLINBURG
msItem.title: Meditationes de Passione Christi
msItem.incipit: Aspice et fac secundum exemplar ...; Etsi Christus ubique in scriptura dicatur mons
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit expositio dominice passionis secundum Iordanem cum suis theoreumatibus et exemplaribus documentis ad honorem eiusdem Domini nostri Ihesu Christi qui pro nobis passus, mortuus et sepultus, resurrexit, uiuit et regnat ...
msItem.note: Many manuscript copies; pr. Antwerp 1485 and frequently thereafter; Zumkeller 646.

msItem.title: Principium Biblicum
msItem.incipit: Stude sapientie. Proverb. 27. Omnem hominem primo generaliter ecclesiasticum et religiosum secundo spiritualiter prelatum
msItem.explicit: ad istum paradisum leticie ualeamus peruenire quod ...
msItem.note: Stegmüller, Bibl. 10197. It is unclear why the scribe did not write on fol. 192v.

supportDesc.extent:
193 leaves (i + 192) 180 125
130 95
The edges heavily retrimmed affecting marginalia and running heads, and spattered with red.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with pencil; written in c. 32 long lines.

handDesc.handNote: Apparently a single loose and rather variable anglicana hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. fol. i was the pastedown in an earlier binding. At its foredge, near the foot, is the mark of a chain-staple, first in brass, replaced in iron; also the mark of a central strap.

history.provenance: At the foot of fol. 5v is ‘Liber collegii de Merton in Oxon’ ex dono Magistri Iohannis Hanham quondam socii eiusdem cuius usus habeatur secundum discrecionem custodis.’ Hanham (BRUO 866) was fellow in 1427–8, until 1438, d. 1494. The gift of this one occurred in that year (Registrum, p. 57).
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents and ‘D. 8, 4’ (canc.), s. xvii, and ‘O. 8. 16. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘H. 1. 8 (CCI)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
